revision.revremark: Adapted the convension used to express the spreadsheet table.

abstract.para: The experimental data set is merely a set of records and a record is a set of values, or a matrix of values. This type of matrix is very-well handled by many existing spreadsheet programs today: Microsoft Excel, Sun StarOffice and OpenOffice to name a few. These applications are all going to use or already have adapted XML as the inter-product exhange format. Unfortunately so far they have exclaimed different syntaxes. Their XML *grammer*, however, has some common feature, which is to see a spreadsheet as a place to lay one or more tables and each table is composed of multiple rows. A row, in turn, is made of multiple cells that contain actual values. We will follow this convension to express our data set in XML even though the actual syntax may not match any of them.

para.screen:
<!ELEMENT spkdata (table)*> <!ATTLIST spkdata version CDATA #REQUIRED>
<!ELEMENT table (description? | row*)> <!ATTLIST table columns CDATA #REQUIRED> <!ATTLIST table rows CDATA #REQUIRED>
<!ELEMENT description (#PCDATA)>
<!ELEMENT row (value)*> <!ATTLIST row position CDATA #REQUIRED>
<ELEMENT value (#PCDATA)> <!ATTLIST value type (numeric|string) #IMPLIED>

listitem.para: The top element of the SpkDataML document. This can contain multiple tables.
The version number of SpkDataML. The initial version is 0.1.
A table or matrix of values. The first row in the table is the header row, which means it contains the labels describing the nature of values/data in the columns.
The number of columns in the table, >=0.
The number of rows in the table, >=0.
A short description for the table.
The position of the row in the table, >=1.
A value (or *cell* if you will) in the row.
The data type of the value: "string" or "numeric", default to "numeric".
